abstract: Altria’s cigarette subsidiary, Philip Morris USA, showed relative strength in the third quarter.
snippet: Altria’s cigarette subsidiary, Philip Morris USA, showed relative strength in the third quarter.
lead_paragraph: The Marlboro Man may not look so tough anymore, but investors shouldn’t write him off. Altria, which makes Marlboros, announced on Wednesday that it had shipped sharply fewer cigarettes in the third quarter than a year earlier. The looming health care reform, meanwhile, could further burden smokers and manufacturers.

headline.main: A Silver Lining Clings to Tobacco
headline.print_headline: A Silver Lining Clings to Tobacco

byline.original: By Aliza Rosenbaum and Ian Campbell

abstract: Altria, which makes Marlboros, said it shipped sharply fewer cigarettes in the third quarter than a year earlier. But the company may just be what value investors call a “cigar-butt” stock, Breakingviews writes.
snippet: Altria, which makes Marlboros, said it shipped sharply fewer cigarettes in the third quarter than a year earlier. But the company may just be what value investors call a “cigar-butt” stock, Breakingviews writes.
lead_paragraph: The Marlboro Man may not look so tough anymore, but investors shouldn’t write him off. Altria, which makes Marlboros, announced on Wednesday that it had shipped sharply fewer cigarettes in the third quarter than a year earlier. The looming health care reform, meanwhile, could further restrain smokers and manufacturers, Breakingviews.com writes.

headline.main: Are Cigarettes Now a Cigar-Butt Stock?
